pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.1.10: The six are linen, cotton, silk, wool, sunn hemp, and hemp; see [](pli-tv-kd8:3.1.6). | According to [](pli-tv-kd8:21.1.4) this is no smaller than 8 by 4 _sugataṅgula_, “standard fingerbreadths”.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.1.21: “A lot” renders _bahukaṃ_. This is based on the commentary to _bhikkhu pācittiya_ 10, [Sp.2.86](): _Sakiṃ āṇatto bahukampi khaṇatīti sacepi sakaladivasaṃ khaṇati, āṇāpakassa ekaṃyeva pācittiyaṃ_, “_Sakiṃ āṇatto bahukampi khaṇatīti_: there is only one offense entailing confession for the one who asks, even if the other digs the entire day.”
